sen.j: 洞院 実熙（とういん さねひろ、応永16年（1409年） - 没年不詳）は、室町時代の公卿。
sen.e: Sanehiro TOIN (1409 - it is not known when he died) was a kugyo (top court official) who lived in the Muromachi period.
Sanehiro TOIN (1409 - date of death unknown) was a kugyo (top court official) who lived during the Muromachi period.
Sanehiro TOIN (1409 - year of death unknown) was a kugyo (court noble) who lived during the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 後花園天皇（102代）・後土御門天皇（103代）の二帝に仕え、官位は従一位左大臣に昇った。
sen.e: He served two emperors of Emperor Gohanazono (the 102nd emperor) and Emperor Gotsuchimikado (the 103rd emperor), and advanced to Sadaijin (minister of the left) at the rank of Juichii (Junior First Rank).

He served two emperors, Emperor Gohanazono (the 102nd emperor) and Emperor Gotsuchimikado (the 103rd emperor), and advanced to Sadaijin (minister of the left) at the rank of Juichii (Junior 1st Rank).
He served two emperors, Emperor Gohanazono (the 102nd) and Emperor Gotsuchimikado (the 103rd), and advanced to Sadaijin (minister of the left) at the rank of Juichii (Junior First Rank).
He was named Sanehiro initially.
He was named Sanehiro initially.
He was named Sanehiro initially.

sen.j: 東山入道左府と称された。
sen.e: He was called Higashiyama-Nyudo-Safu (literally, a priest in Higashi-yama Mountain who was once Sadaijin (minister of the left)).
He was called Higashiyama-Nyudo-Safu (literally, a priest in Higashi-yama Mountain who was once Sadaijin - minister of the left).
He was called Higashiyama-Nyudo-Safu (literally, a priest in Mt. Higashi who was once Sadaijin - minister of the left.
His father was Mitsusue TOIN, Udaijin (minister of the Interior).
His father was Mitsusue TOIN, Udaijin (minister of the Interior).
His father was Mitsusue TOIN, Udaijin (minister of the Interior).

sen.j: 子に権大納言洞院公数がいる。
sen.e: Kinkazu TOIN, Gon Dainagon (a provisional major counselor), was his son.
Kinkazu TOIN, Gon Dainagon (a provisional major counselor), was his son.
Kinkazu TOIN, Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state), was his son.

sen.j: 左近衛中将・伊予権守を経て、応永31年（1424年）に従三位に叙せられ、公卿に列する。
sen.e: He was awarded the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), becoming a kugyo, after assuming Sakone no chujo (a middle captain of the left division of inner palace guards) and Iyo no Gon no kami (a provisional governor of Iyo Province).

He was awarded the rank of Jusanmi (Junior 3rd Rank), becoming a kugyo, after assuming Sakone no chujo (a middle captain of the left division of inner palace guards) and Iyo no Gon no kami (a provisional governor of Iyo Province).

He was awarded the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), in 1424 becoming a kugyo, after assuming Sakone no chujo (a middle captain of the left division of inner palace guards) and Iyo no Gon no kami (a provisional governor of Iyo Province).

sen.j: 正長元年（1428年）に権中納言となるも翌年に勅勘にふれて一度解官される。
sen.e: Although appointed to Gon Chunagon (a provisional middle counselor) in 1428, he was censured by the emperor in the next year and was dismissed from the post once.
Although appointed to Gon Chunagon (provisional middle counselor) in 1428, he was censured by the emperor in the following year and was dismissed from the post once.
Although appointed to Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state) in 1428, he was censured by the emperor in the following year and was dismissed from the post once.

sen.j: 永享2年（1430年）に赦免されて再出仕し、改めて権中納言に任じられた。
sen.e: In 1430, he was pardoned and attended at the court again, and was appointed to Gon Chunagon anew.
In 1430, he was pardoned and attended the court again, and was appointed to Gon Chunagon anew.
In 1430, he was pardoned and attended the court again, and was appointed to Gon Chunagon anew.

sen.j: 永享4年（1432年）には権大納言へ昇進。
sen.e: In 1432, he was promoted to Gon Dainagon (a provisional major counselor).
In 1432, he was promoted to Gon Dainagon (a provisional major counselor).
In 1432, he was promoted to Gon Dainagon.
sen.cmt: 用語統一(a provisional chief councilor of state)削除(前出のため）

sen.j: 内教坊別当を経て、嘉吉2年（1442年）には右近衛大将・右馬寮御監に任じられる。
sen.e: After assuming Naikyobo no Betto (the chief of Naikyobo (a place in Imperial Palace where singing and dancing was taught), he was appointed to Ukone no daisho (the major captain of the right division of inner palace guards) and Umaryo gogen (an inspector of the right division of Bureau of Horses) in 1442.

After assuming Naikyobo no Betto (the chief of Naikyobo (a place in Imperial Palace where singing and dancing was taught), he was appointed to Ukone no daisho (the major captain of the right division of inner palace guards) and Umaryo gogen (an inspector of the right division of Bureau of Horses) in 1442.

After assuming Naikyobo no Betto (the chief of Naikyobo, a place in Imperial Palace where singing and dancing was taught), he was appointed to Ukone no daisho (the major captain of the right division of inner palace guards) and Umaryo gogen (an inspector of the right division of Bureau of Horses) in 1442.

sen.j: 文安3年（1446年）に内大臣拝命、さらに翌年には左近衛大将を兼務する。
sen.e: In 1446, he was appointed to Naidaijin (minister of the Interior), and assumed Sakone no daisho (the major captain of the left division of inner palace guards) additionally in the next year.
In 1446, he was appointed to Naidaijin (minister of the Interior), and assumed Sakone no daisho (the major captain of the left division of inner palace guards) additionally in the next year.
In 1446, he was appointed to Naidaijin (minister of the Interior), and assumed Sakone no daisho (the major captain of the left division of inner palace guards) additionally in the next year.

sen.j: 文安5年（1448年）に左近衛大将のみ辞職。
sen.e: In 1448, he resigned from Sakone no daisho alone.
In 1448, he resigned from Sakone no daisho alone.
In 1448, he resigned from Sakone no daisho alone.

sen.j: 宝徳2年（1450年）には従一位を授与されたが、この年に内大臣も辞した。
sen.e: In 1450, he was awarded Juichii (Junior First Rank), but resigned from Udaijin within the same year.
In 1450, he was awarded Juichii (Junior 1st Rank), but resigned from Udaijin within the same year.
In 1450, he was awarded Juichii (Junior First Rank), but resigned from Udaijin within the same year.

sen.j: 享徳3年（1454年）には右大臣となり、さらに康正元年（1455年）左大臣に任じられた。
sen.e: He became Udaijin (minister of the right) in 1454, and was appointed to Sadaijin (minister of the left) in 155.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He became Udaijin (minister of the right) in 1454, and was appointed to Sadaijin (minister of the left) in 155.
He became Udaijin (minister of the right) in 1454, and was appointed to Sadaijin (minister of the left) in 1455.

sen.j: しかしながら同年中に辞職。
sen.e: However, he resigned form the post within the same year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, he resigned form the post within the same year.
However, he resigned from the post within the same year.

sen.j: このあと出家して東山に昇り隠居生活に入った。
sen.e: After this, he moved to the Higashi-yama Mountain area, and started a retired and quiet life.
After this, he moved to the Higashi-yama Mountain area, and began a retired and quiet life.
After this, he moved to the Mt. Higashi area, and began a retired and quiet life.
